The Buddha said:

It is like a dark night when torches are lit on both sides of a city gate. There are countless people coming and going. If one looks from the darkness, one sees those coming and going in the light of the torches.
The Buddha said:

I use my heavenly eye to observe the people of the world. Those who die and ascend to the heavens or enter the hells are like people looking from the darkness at those coming and going in the light of the torches. It is like looking down from a high tower, seeing the thousands of households below.
The Buddha said:
I see the people of the world. Those who die and ascend to the heavens or enter the hells are like a person looking at the various households from a high tower. The Buddha said:
It is like a person traveling in a boat on clear water, seeing all the fish and stones in the water.
The Buddha uses his heavenly eye to observe the people of the world, those who go up to heaven after death and those who enter hell, like a person looking at the fish and stones in clear water.
There is a bright pearl, strung with five-colored threads. When people look at the pearl, they see all the five colors, knowing separately that they are strung through with the pearl.

In this way, tens of thousands of people enter. The guardians of hell put them inside. Day and night, they cannot get out. The gates are all closed and cannot be opened. People stay there for tens of thousands of years, the fire does not go out, and the people do not die.
After a long time, they see the eastern gate open from afar. People all run to exit.
As soon as they reach the gate, the gate closes again. The people who want to exit fight among themselves at the gate, wanting to get out.

After a long time, they see the southern gate open again, and everyone runs towards it. The gate closes again, and the people fight among themselves at the gate.

There is a hot wind there. When they encounter it, they cannot escape. They want to die but cannot die, and want to live but cannot live. In this way, they suffer for a long time, for many tens of thousands of years, before they can escape.

People think they have escaped, but they enter the sixth hell, Ayu-tsa-po-ni-huan-ni-li, where there are many trees with thorns. Between the trees are ghosts. In this way, for many thousands of years, they finally emerge.
People think they have escaped, but they enter the seventh hell, Pan-shi-wu-ni-li.

In it there are worms called quail. When people enter there, the worms fly in and enter their mouths, eating the people's bodies. He then took a hook, hooked their upper and lower jaws, and opened their mouths wide. He then poured molten copper into their mouths, which all burned and rotted. In this way, they sought death but could not die, and sought life but could not live.
In their previous lives, when they were people in the world, they did great evil, and sought release but could not be released.
